metadata.commander_name: Major-General Noel Monson de la Poer Beresford-Peirse

narrative.title: 4Th Indian Division - 1941Q1
narrative.situation: British Indian Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1941Q1.
narrative.objectives: Mobile infantry division optimized for desert and semi-arid warfare. Proven capability in offensive operations against fortified positions.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

supply.notes: Operating in East African theater with extended supply lines from Sudan. Water supply critical in desert/semi-arid environment.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mountain warfare experience from North-West Frontier
Multi-ethnic cohesion (British, Indian, Punjabi, Rajput units)

supply_states.notes: Operating in East African theater with extended supply lines from Sudan. Water supply critical in desert/semi-arid environment.
